title: Domino’s Pizza Stock Has Slumped, but One Big Investor Bought Up Shares
text:
Domino’s Pizza stock has gone cold in 2019, but a large shareholder recently grabbed a bigger slice of the pie.

Domino’s stock (ticker: DPZ) has slumped 4.3% this year through Friday’s close, including a 14.7% plunge since the end of the first half of 2019. Shares of the pizza chain were pummeled in mid-July after second-quarter same-store sales missed expectations. We noted that the rise of GrubHub (GRUB) and Uber Technologies (UBER) unit Uber Eats have hurt Domino’s operations by easing delivery from many other restaurants....
description: Hedge fund Lone Pine disclosed that it had recently bought nearly $200 million of shares of the pizza chain. It is now Domino’s fourth-largest shareholder.
